New Records: Stephen Curry coached his 800th game, becoming the 18th coach to reach that milestone with only one team.
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored 16 of his 24 points in the second half, leading the Warriors past the Wizards, 125-112.
The Wizards trailed by just five in the fourth quarter, but Golden State responded with a jumper by Jonathan Kuminga.
Pre-Game Insights: The first three games of Golden State's winning streak came without Curry, but he was able to start against the Wizards, although he played only 24:05.
Post-Match Reflections: Washington Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels was at the game and received a huge ovation from the crowd.
Kyshawn George had 20 points, but the Wizards shot just 23% from 3-point range.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Buddy Hield scored 20 points, part of another strong contribution from the Golden State bench.
Jordan Poole led Washington with 24 points.
Kyle Kuzma (right groin strain) missed his third straight game for the Wizards, and Marvin Bagley III (illness) also sat out.
Others: The Warriors have averaged an edge of 24 points per game in bench points so far this season.
This was Stephen Curry's return from an ankle injury.
